bibliography:
Alston, W.P. (1967), ‘Pleasure’ in P. Edwards
(ed.) The Encyclopaedia of Philosophy, London:
Macmillan.

a grammatical feature’, in R.J. Butler (ed.), Analytical

Available online in English or

Morals and Legislation, London: T.Payne and Son.

University Press.

Brandt, R. (1979), A Theory of the Good and the
Right, Oxford: Clarendon Press.

Brentano, F. (1874/1973), Psychology From An Empirical

Routledge and Kegan Paul.

Brentano, F. (1889/1969), The Origin of Our Knowledge of
Right and Wrong. English language edition, R. Chisholm (ed.),
London: Routledge and Kegan Paul.

Broad, C.D. (1930), Five Types of Ethical Theory,
London: Routledge and Kegan Paul.

Butler, J. (1729), Fifteen Sermons Preached at the Rolls
Chapel, London: James and John Knapton.

Carroll, L. (1871), Through the Looking Glass, 
London: Macmillan.

Chisholm, R. (1986), Brentano and Intrinsic Value,
Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

Crane, T. (2001), The Elements of Mind, Oxford: Oxford
University Press.

Crisp, R. (1997), Mill on Utilitarianism, London:

Crisp, R. (2006), Reasons and the Good, Oxford: Oxford
University Press.

Dennett, D. (1988), ‘Quining qualia’, in

Feldman, F. (2001), ‘Hedonism’, in
Encyclopedia of Ethics, L.C. Becker and C.B. Becker

Feldman, F. (2004), Pleasure and the Good Life,
Oxford: Clarendon Press.

Flanagan, O. (1992), Consciousness Reconsidered,
Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.

Forster, E.M. (1910), Howards End, New York:
A.A. Knopf.

Glover, J. (1984), What Sort of People Should There
Be?, New York: Penguin.

Griffin, J.P. (1986), Well-Being: Its Meaning, Measurement,

Heathwood, C. (2007), ‘The reduction of sensory

Hooker, B. (1996). ‘Does Being Virtuous Constitute a

Hooker, B. (2000), Ideal Code, Real World: A

Lewis, D. (1986), On the Plurality of Worlds,

Moore, G.E. (1903), Principia Ethica, Cambridge:

Nagel, T. (1970), ‘Death’, Noûs, 4(1):

Nagel, T. (1989), The View From Nowhere, Oxford: Oxford

Nozick, R. (1971), ‘On the Randian Argument’,

Nozick, R. (1974), Anarchy, State, and Utopia, Oxford:
